availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George A. Trumbo (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Charlotte Trumbo. Father of William Trumbo, Mary A. Trumbo, Oliver Trumbo, Benjamin Trumbo, Henriette Trumbo, and Jennette Trumbo. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Bath County in 1850. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as supply 2nd lieutenant from November 22, 1862, to September 14, 1863. Shot and killed in Bath County, Kentucky on September 21, 1865, a crime for which Jesse and David Underwood were accused.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 62A.

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 253.
KYR-0001-005-0126.
